intro: Rosa gallica f. umbricola, commonly known as the dark pink garden rose, is a cultivar of the species Rosa gallica. It is characterized by its deep pink to almost black flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is a deciduous shrub with thorny stems and dark green, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it suitable for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value lies in its striking flower color and fragrant aroma.
